fuse.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power
blow a fuse (=make it melt by putting too much electricity through it)
fuse.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I taught him how to change a fuse.
fuse.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a thing that delays a bomb, firework etc from exploding until you are a safe distance away, or makes it explode at a particular time
fuse.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to join together physically, or to make things join together, and become a single thing
fuse.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The egg and sperm fuse together as one cell.
fuse.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to combine different qualities, ideas, or things, or to be combined
fuse.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Their music fuses elements as diverse as Cajun, bebop and Cuban waltzes.
Leonard takes Carver-style dirty realism and fuses it with the pace of a detective story.
We intend to fuse the companies into a single organization.
fuse.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if electrical equipment fuses, or if you fuse it, it stops working because a fuse has melted
fuse.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: if a rock or metal fuses, or if you fuse it, it becomes liquid by being heated
fuse.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Lead fuses at quite a low temperature.
fuse.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to join two or more companies together, forming a single organization
fuse.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: We intend to fuse the separate companies into a single business organization.
